channel.title: Thoughts by Liz Carey
channel.description: Recent content on Thoughts by Liz Carey

item.title: 2018 Recap: Books I Read
item.description: Books I read in 2018 Here’s a list of books I read in 2018 in no particular order. Ratings are out of 5 stars. Less (Winner of the Pulitzer Prize): A Novel By Andrew Sean Greer ‚≠êÔ∏è ‚≠êÔ∏è ‚≠êÔ∏è ‚≠êÔ∏è How to Change Your Mind By Michael Pollan ‚≠êÔ∏è ‚≠êÔ∏è ‚≠êÔ∏è I “read” this one via an audiobook. It was fun to have it narrated by Michael Pollan due to his natural cadence and rhythm in reading.

item.title: Reflecting on Christmas dinner
item.description: A sign of getting older is when visiting home for the holidays is more stressful than not. With every year that passes, a responsibility gets added to my plate. And with this year, both the metaphorical and literal plate as preparing Christmas dinner became one of the layered responsibilities. And like all great heroes, I didn‚Äôt ask for this responsibility; it was simply bestowed upon me against my will.

item.title: About
item.description: This website is a work in progress…just. like. me. Hopefully I’ll have this up and running with content sooooooon. Boredom is the only real tragedy for a writer; everything else is material. ‚Äï Andrew Sean Greer, Less Bay Area born and raised, I currently work as a User Experience researcher based in San Francisco. I work in both qualitative and quantitative methods.

item.title: Starting a blog
item.description: I finally started a blog! I first thought about starting a blog 3 years ago. I never went through it because: I didn‚Äôt know where to begin I couldn‚Äôt think of any content Laziness The trick is to set aside a few hours and commit. If you‚Äôre familiar with R, the only resource you need is Yihui Xie‚Äôs blogdown book. Key tips that helped me publish this blog:
